description: Students explore French-speaking regions of the world outside France through the close reading, discussion, and analysis of literary and non-literary texts as well as other cultural artifacts. Readings, discussions, viewings, and written and oral assignments are organized around the exploration of specific topics or themes. May be repeated if geographical region is different. Taught in French. Prerequisite: minimum of one 250-level course (two recommended). Counts towards Africa and the Americas concentration when topic is Francophone Africa.
name: Fr World: The Maghreb
prerequisites: minimum of one 250-level course (two recommended). Counts towards Africa and the Americas concentration when topic is Francophone Africa.
